citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
IACUC approved protocol TSR 6343 includes a blood collection procedure. The IACUC Guidance on Blood Collection in
Animals SOP states that the acceptable blood withdrawal volume for a serial repeated blood sample calculates to a
volume of 10% Total Blood Volume(TBV). A review of records for a blood collection procedure performed on August 28,
2024 indicate that one animal, Animal ID 1:1, had a volume of blood collected which equaled 12 % TBV.
This is a change from the parameters described in the IACUC approved protocol.
Failure to follow the IACUC approved protocol can negatively affect the animals health and well being. All changes to
procedures involving animals must be reviewed and approved by the IACUC before implementation in order to determine
the effects on the animals.
The facility has initiated corrective actions consisting of retraining staff as well as implementing additional changes to the
blood collection process. The issue is scheduled to be discussed at the next IACUC meeting, which will be the first
meeting since the incident occurred.
******Corrected by September 16, 2024 or by the next IACUC meeting
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
